ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] DELETE and 404 Not Found
ygData.msgSnippet: I m not sure there was consesus on this.  As I recall, this issue came down to whether the end state of a DELETE is what s important or the state change

I'm not sure there was consesus on this.  As I recall, this issue came down
to whether the end state of a DELETE is what's important or the state change
itself.  If the state change is important, then returning a 404 would
indicate that there was no state change (since the resource did not exist).
On the other hand, if the end state was important, then returning a 200 (or
204) would always be used whether the resource existed at the time of the
request or not, since the end state would be the same either way.
Personally, I'd say it depends on the requirements of the application...

---
Seairth Jacobs
seairth@...

From: "Richard Padley" <rest-discuss@...>
>
> I recall reading a while ago that returning an HTTP status 404 against a
> delete request was the wrong thing to do. Can anyone enlighten me as to
> why?
